tell me about the.answer: Welcome to Nalanda Library! We're the heart of academic life at IIT Ropar. 📚 We have over 25,000 books, thousands of e-journals, and amazing research databases like Scopus, Web of Science, and MathSciNet. Plus, you get access to cool tools like Turnitin for plagiarism checks, Grammarly for writing, and Overleaf for LaTeX. We use modern RFID technology and have a 24/7 OPAC system to help you find what you need anytime!

library timing|what are library timings.answer: Great news - we're open 24/7! 🕐 The Ground Floor (with stacks and Reading Area 2) never closes. The First Floor is available from 6 AM to 2 AM. You can use our self-service kiosks anytime to issue or return books. If you need staff help, we're here from 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM on working days!

fine policy.answer: Fine & Penalty Policy (Nalanda Library, IIT Ropar): ₹2.00 per day for the first week after the due date. The fine amount doubles every subsequent week (₹4.00, ₹8.00, ₹16.00, etc.).

technobooth.answer: Our Technobooth is awesome! 💻 It's a Digital Learning Hub with rooms that have big interactive touch screens (two 65-inch and one 55-inch). Perfect for group study, presentations, or digital projects! Each room fits 4-6 people and you can book it for up to 2 hours a day. Great for multimedia work, virtual meetings, or group assignments. reading room facilities.answer:

what is technobooth|technobooth facility.answer:
Technobooth (Digital Learning Hub) is a dedicated space in Nalanda Library for group presentations, assignments, digital projects, multimedia content creation, and virtual meetings.

📌 Facilities:
- 3 rooms (each seating 4-6 persons)
- Interactive Touch Screen Monitors (two 65-inch, one 55-inch)
- Usage limited to 2 hours per day

📌 Guidelines:
- Reservation requires in-person visit (no advance bookings)
- Do not lock booth and leave the library
- Use only for tech-related activities (not general study)
- Check-in/check-out with staff is mandatory
- Handle equipment carefully; report damages
- No downloads/installs; save work to cloud (not USBs)
- Maintain low noise during usage
- No food/drinks allowed
- First-time users may need brief training
- Misuse can lead to penalties or ban; users are liable for damages
- Feedback is encouraged to improve the facility

default|unanswered|no_match|__default__|.answer: Sorry, I could not find an answer to your query. Please visit the official library website for more information: https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/index.php

opac.answer: OPAC: https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in — search catalogue, check availability, renew items and place reservations.

borrowing limits|can you tell me borrowi.answer: Borrowing limits: Faculty - 12 books (1 semester), Staff - 4 books (1 semester), PhD Scholars - 6 books (4 weeks), PG Students - 5 books (2 weeks), UG Students - 3 books + 1 Book Bank (1 semester). Reference materials and theses are non-circulating.

printing and ing|can you tell me printin.answer: Printing, facility is available in the library. Charges apply (approx. ₹1 per side). Users must comply with copyright regulations. Check the helpdesk for current rates.

plagiarism and turnitin|can you tell me.answer: Turnitin similarity checks are available. To request a report, email libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in with details.

electronic document delivery.answer: EDD/ILL: Request articles or chapters via subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in, Library arranges delivery under license agreements.

library vision and mission|can you tell.answer: The vision of Nalanda Library is to support the academic and research needs of IIT Ropar by providing access to information resources, fostering lifelong learning, and creating an inclusive environment that promotes knowledge sharing.

library annual report|can you tell me li.answer: Nalanda Library publishes annual reports highlighting achievements, resource growth, and services. Visit https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/ for the latest reports and brochures.

library staff and committee|can you tell.answer: Nalanda Library is managed by professional staff under the guidance of the Library Committee chaired by senior faculty members. Staff details are listed on the library website.

institute smart id card|can you tell me.answer: The Institute-cum-Library Smart ID Card serves as both institute and library ID. Lost card incur a ₹300 fine for first reissue, doubling for each subsequent replacement.

lost smart id card|smart id card replace.answer:
🆔 Duplicate ID Card Information:

Fees Structure:
• First duplicate: ₹300
• Subsequent duplicates: Charges may double
• Payment: online payment at Library Helpdesk

1. Report to library Helpdesk

reference service.answer: Library staff assist users in locating materials, literature searches, and citation support through the reference desk or via email at libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in.

subject and research guide|can you tell.answer: Subject-wise e-resources and research guides are available to help students and researchers locate relevant material efficiently. Check the library’s resource section for details.

seat booking or article request|can you.answer: Users can book reading seats or request articles via the library portal at https://studyatlib.iitrpr.ac.in.

digital and print periodicals|can you te.answer: The library subscribes to digital and select print periodicals across disciplines. Lists are available on the website.

economic and political database|can you.answer: Access to the Economic & Political Database is provided to support humanities and social science research. Check the e-resources page for direct links.

scientometric and patent tools|can you t.answer: The library offers access to scientometric tools and patent databases for research evaluation and intellectual property searches.

cds and dvds collection|can you tell me.answer: The library maintains a collection of CDs, DVDs, and other multimedia resources for academic use.

membership for iit ropar students|can yo.answer: All registered students, faculty, and staff of IIT Ropar are automatic members of Nalanda Library and can access all facilities using their institute ID.

membership for outsiders|can you tell me.answer: Nalanda Library offers external membership to Academic Institutions, Research Organizations, Government Departments, Industry, and individual academicians, researchers, and alumni. Membership is approved by the institute and requires a refundable security deposit as per library policy.

faculty privileges|can you tell me facul.answer: Faculty members can issue up to 12 books, request EDD/ILL, and access e-resources off-campus via VPN. They also get Turnitin and Overleaf support.

academic and author tools|can you tell m.answer: Nalanda Library provides institutional access to Grammarly (academic writing support), Overleaf (collaborative LaTeX writing), and Turnitin (plagiarism detection). Contact libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in for account setup or help.

copyright guidelines|can you tell me cop.answer: Users must adhere to copyright and fair use guidelines. Unauthorized copying or distribution of copyrighted material is strictly prohibited.

institutional repository.answer: IIT Ropar's Institutional Repository hosts theses, dissertations, and publications by faculty and students. It can be accessed through the library website.

vpn and off campus access|can you tell m.answer: Library e-resources can be accessed off-campus through IIT Ropar’s VPN. Use institute credentials to log in and access subscribed databases and journals remotely.

books arrangement plan|can you tell me b.answer: Books are arranged according to the Dewey Decimal Classification (DDC) system on each floor, with signage and directory assistance.

library floor plan|can you tell me libra.answer: The library has multiple floors — ground for circulation and reading, upper floors for reference and periodicals. Detailed plans are displayed near the entrance.

empanelled vendors|can you tell me empan.answer: Nalanda Library procures books and journals through approved empanelled vendors and subscription agents.

grammarly access|what is grammarly how t.answer: Grammarly is a comprehensive AI writing assistant designed to enhance writing quality and correctness. To access, please sign up with your institutional mail id on grammarly site.

overleaf access|can you tell me overleaf.answer: IIT Ropar provides institutional access to Overleaf for collaborative LaTeX writing and research documentation. Visit https://www.overleaf.com/edu/iitrpr.

pressreader access|can you tell me press.answer: PressReader offers 7,000+ newspapers and magazines from 130+ countries in 60+ languages. It is accessible through Nalanda Library’s e-resources portal via campus or VPN access.

library contact details|can you tell me.answer: Nalanda Library, Indian Institute of Technology Ropar, Punjab - 140001. Email: libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in

library membership|can you tell me libra.answer: All registered IIT Ropar students, faculty, and staff are automatic members of Nalanda Library. External membership available for approved categories upon request.

what is nalanda library at iit ropar|tel.answer: Nalanda Library (Nalanda Library Information System) is the central academic library of IIT Ropar providing print and digital resources, research support services, institutional repository (DSpace), and e-resource access for students, faculty, and staff.

where is nalanda library located|where i.answer: Nalanda Library is located in the academic complex of IIT Ropar main campus, Rupnagar (Ropar). Contact details and directions are available on the library Contact page.

what sections does the library have|libr.answer: The library includes reading halls, book stacks, reference section, periodicals, digital access area, discussion/group rooms, and reprographyPrinting facilities.

what is the library vision and mission|w.answer: The library's mission is to support the institute's teaching, learning and research by providing timely access to quality information resources, services and digital tools, and by promoting information literacy among users.

what e-resources are available at iit ro.answer: IIT Ropar library provides access to e-journals, e-books, databases and research tools including IEEE Xplore, ACM Digital Library, ScienceDirect, SpringerLink, JSTOR, Web of Science, Scopus, MathSciNet, and specialized databases accessed via ONOS and institutional subscriptions.

how do i access e-resources from off cam.answer: Off-campus access to subscribed e-resources is available through the IIT Ropar VPN. Connect to the institute VPN using your credentials, then access library portals or publisher sites as usual.

what is the process to get vpn access fo.answer: VPN access is provided by IIT Ropar IT services. Use institute credentials to set up the VPN client; contact the library helpdesk or IT support for configuration help and troubleshooting.

what is onos for iit ropar|explain onos.answer: ONOS (Online Network of Shared Resources) is a consortium service providing centralized access to e-resources shared among IITs. IIT Ropar users can access 30+ publisher resources via ONOS (publisher list as on 01.11.2025).

which publishers are included in onos li.answer: ONOS includes major publishers such as AAAS (Science), ACM, ACS, AIAA, AIP, AMS, APS, Annual Reviews, ASCE, ASME, Bentham Science, BMJ, Cambridge University Press, Elsevier (ScienceDirect), Emerald, IEEE, IOP, Oxford, Sage, Springer Nature, Taylor & Francis, Wiley and others (30+ publishers).

how to access onos resources|how to use.answer: Access ONOS resources via the IIT Ropar library website (ONOS page) or through publisher links provided there. On-campus access is direct; off-campus requires VPN authentication.

what are the major library rules at iit.answer: Major rules include maintaining silence, keeping mobile phones on silent, no food or drinks inside, carrying institute ID/Smart card, following seat booking rules, and respecting return/renewal policies for issued items.

are bags allowed inside the library|can.answer: Bags should be left at the designated racks or cloak area; personal large bags are not allowed inside reading areas to maintain space and security.

what is the overdue fine policy|what are.answer: The overdue fine policy is described on the library site and may vary by user category. Typical policies include daily fines for late returns; check 'Overdue & Fine Policy' on the library pages or your OPAC account for exact rates.

what is iit ropar dspace|what is dspace|.answer: IIT Ropar's DSpace is the institutional repository that stores and provides open access to theses, dissertations, project reports, faculty publications, conference papers and technical reports. Accessible via the DSpace URL (institutional repository).

how to download phd thesis from dspace|d.answer: Visit the DSpace repository, search by author/title/department, and download the PDF of available theses. Most theses are open access and can be downloaded without login.

how to submit thesis to dspace|how to up.answer: Contact the library helpdesk with the final PDF and metadata (title, abstract, keywords, department). The library staff processes submissions and uploads items to DSpace, assigning a permanent handle.

what services does nalanda library provi.answer: Key services: circulation (issue/return), OPAC search, reference & information service, e-resource access, inter-library loan (ILL), electronic document delivery (EDD), plagiarism check (Turnitin), research support, training/orientation, reprography (printing), and institutional repository assistance.

does the library offer inter library loa.answer: Yes, Inter Library Loan (ILL) / Document Delivery services are available for material not held by the library. Request via the subscriptions/ILL contact email or library helpdesk.

how can i request an article not availab.answer: Use the 'Request an Article' / EDD form or email on subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in with citation details. The library will attempt to obtain the article via subscriptions or ILL and notify you when available.

how do i contact nalanda library|how to.answer: Contact the library via helpdesk email (libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in) or listed phone numbers. Librarian and subscriptions contacts are available on the Contact page.

where to find library forms and download.answer: Forms and downloadable policies (membership, ILL request, repository submission etc.) are available under the 'Forms' or 'Downloads' section on the library website.

how to check new arrivals in the library.answer: Check the 'New Arrivals' section on the library homepage or search OPAC (opac.iitrpr.ac.in) for recently added books and periodicals.

how to search the library catalogue|how.answer: Use the OPAC at opac.iitrpr.ac.in to search by title, author, subject, ISBN, or call number. Logged-in users can view issued items, due dates, renew books, and place reservations.

institutional repository iit ropar|insti.answer: IIT Ropar's Institutional Digital Repository (IDR) hosts digital copies of theses, dissertations, and research publications from the institute. Access the repository through the library website at https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/. It provides open access to scholarly output produced by IIT Ropar researchers.

new arrivals in library|can you tell me.answer: New arrivals and recently added books are displayed on the library website and near the Library Helpdesk. You can also search OPAC (opac.iitrpr.ac.in) with date filters to find latest additions. The library regularly updates collections based on curriculum needs and user recommendations.

what should I do if the book I borrowed.answer: You will be given two weeks time to replace the same copy of a new book along with the payment of overdue fines if any. If the book is unavailable in the market for purchase, you are required to pay the gross price of the book i.e. price of the book at the time of purchase; along with the fine accumulated.

how to recommend a book for purchase|boo.answer: You can recommend book via your OPAC login portal or by filling out indent form or by Printing QR code (near the helpdesk).

normal time period for receiving suggest.answer: Usually it takes around one month.

how do I know whether suggested books ha.answer: You will be informed via email as soon as books will be arrived in the library.

how many books I can suggest|book sugges.answer: There is no such limit on suggesting the numbers of books.

whom to contact for book procurement que.answer: You can contact Dr. Harpreet Kaur at the library office or email your query to harpreetkaur@iitrpr.ac.in

procedure of donating books to library|b.answer: The student can donate the books in the library by submitting the books with their name written on it to Dr. Harpreet Kaur.

how can I be alerted to new items acquir.answer: Newly procured books are displayed in the new arrival areas. Users can also check for new arrivals though OPAC.

I want to issue a book but it's damaged|.answer: Before issuing the book, the user should check it properly to ensure that there is no damage, if so ,report to library circulation counter, otherwise he/she will be held responsible for damage, if found at the time of returning of the book.

can I borrow book from friend's card|bor.answer: It is suggested to bring your own id card to borrow book to avoid any confusion.

can I return book without card|return wi.answer: Yes, you can return book without a card or from somebody else's card.

can I issue book without card|issue with.answer: No, you must carry your card to issue book.

can I renew book without bringing to lib.answer: Borrower should bring the books physically to the library for renewal.

how many books can I issue and for how l.answer: Find complete details of user issue privileges here: https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/pdf/library_brochure_2016.pdf

what to do if book I want is already iss.answer: You can place a hold on it through OPAC login portal.

how will I know reserved book is availab.answer: Once the reserved book is returned in the library , you will receive an email notification about the book.

how much fine for late return|late retur.answer: Fine & Penalty Policy (Nalanda Library, IIT Ropar): ₹2.00 per day for the first week after the due date. The fine amount doubles every subsequent week (₹4.00, ₹8.00, ₹16.00, etc.). For exact charges and exceptions, contact libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in.

where to pay fine|fine payment process.answer: For the payment you need to scan the QR Code on the Library Helpdesk. After making the payment you need to fill the Google Sheet for the transaction record.

what to do if book I want to issue is da.answer: Before issuing the book, the user should check it properly to ensure that there is no damage, if so missing pages, report to library helpdesk counter, otherwise he/she will be held responsible for damage, if found at the time of returning of the book.

how to cancel reserved document|cancel b.answer: To cancel reserved documents, kindly utilize the KOHA WEBOPAC. Log in to your account and proceed to cancel the reserved document(s).

where can I get reserved document|reserv.answer: You can pick up the reserved book at the library helpdesk.

how many times can I renew book|book ren.answer: You can renew books multiple times through kiosk before the due date, as long as no other user has reserved the book. Each renewal extends the loan period based on your user category. Check OPAC 'My Account' for renewal status and eligibility.

what is kiosk|library kiosk.answer: A kiosk is a self service station in the library where you can check out , return or renew books on your own.

how to borrow book using kiosk|kiosk bor.answer: Steps to borrow books: Place your card on the scanner ->enter password-> place book/books on scanner->click on checkout.

can library recall issued book|library b.answer: Library staff may recall the book at any time before the due date in the case of emergency.

do I have to make entry for issued book.answer: Yes, please ensure to make entry for issued book in register every time you bring the books to the library.

can I issue books if I have fine due|iss.answer: Yes, it depends upon case to case basis, if overdue charges are more than Rs. 100/- then you have to pay fine to continue transaction. Amount less than Rs. 100/- can be paid at the end of the semester.

can I issue books on display|display boo.answer: Yes, books on display are available for loan.

how to know book is overdue|overdue noti.answer: You will be intimated with e-mail notification for your overdue materials. In that case, you need to return/renew the books to avoid heavy fines.

what to do if issued book got damaged|da.answer: If a book gets damaged, please bring it to the library helpdesk as soon as possible. Library staff will assess the damage and inform you on repair or replacement.

do I get email notification for transact.answer: Yes, you will receive an e-mail notification for your transactions of issue/return/renew.

can I renew my books|book renewal proces.answer: You can renew the books if there are no reservations on them. The borrower has to bring the book physically to the library and can be renewed through self-service Kiosk. Faculty members and Research scholars can renew the reference books on staff station only.

can I get books for vacations|vacation b.answer: You can borrow one book for the vacation period. The issue of the book will start one week before the vacation and due date will be the first working day of every semester.

what are timings for issue return books|.answer: Self-service Kiosk: 24/7 throughout the year. Staff Station: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM daily (extended during exam periods).

what are periodicals|periodicals definit.answer: Periodicals are the publications like magazines, journals and newspapers that are released on a regular schedule , such as weekly , monthly , quarterly etc.

what type of periodicals in library|libr.answer: Please visit https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/print_resources.php for print periodicals details. Please visit https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/e-journals.php for E-periodical details.

can I issue periodicals|periodicals borr.answer: Only the back volumes of periodicals can be borrowed for 2 days.

how to recommend journal newspaper magaz.answer: Please contact Dr. Tarvinder Handa subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in

how to know suggested journal arrived|jo.answer: You will be informed via email as soon as books will be arrived in the library.

whom to contact for journal procurement|.answer: Please send your queries at subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in

how to access e resources|e-resources ac.answer: You can access e-resources by connecting to the library wifi. The wifi password is displayed on the wall near the helpdesk.

is there limitation on downloading artic.answer: Yes, systematic downloading of the articles is strictly prohibited.

what are licensing restrictions|licensin.answer: Electronic resources subscribed by IIT Ropar are restricted to users of IIT Ropar by license agreement for the purposes of research, teaching, and private study. Using these resources for commercial purpose, systematic downloading, copying or distributing of information is expressly prohibited.

what to do if can't find required articl.answer: please mail to subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in for assistance.

what are types of e-resources in library.answer: Please visit https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/e-journals.php for e journals, https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/other_tools.php for online research tools, https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/e_books.php for e books, https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/databases.php for databases.

what is EDD service|EDD service.answer: EDD is one of the important services of the libraries in electronic age and it works almost like ILL service. It refers to the delivery of the article(s)/chapter(s)/electronic copies of the document from the member libraries. Generally one library request the another library for the electronic resources which they have not subscribed.

how does EDD service work|EDD service pr.answer: In IIT Ropar, user(s) sends the bibliographical details along with the web link to subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in and library arrange the articles from their subscription or from the member libraries depending on the availability. Our library also helps the other member libraries by providing electronic copies of the article(s) within the frame work of Publisher(s) license agreement.

OPAC technical definition|OPAC definitio.answer: An Online Public Access Catalogue (OPAC) is an online portal of Library Automation System used to search the library resources and members transactions.

where can I access OPAC|OPAC access.answer: OPAC is user friendly and accessible anywhere, any time. Users can search the books by entering various fields like Title, Author, Subject, Keyword, Accession & Class Numbers etc and track the physical location of books in the Library. OPAC can be accessed by visiting the below mentioned link: https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in

is OPAC accessible on mobile|OPAC mobile.answer: Users can search books using OPAC through their Smartphone and tablets also.

how to search book in OPAC|OPAC book sea.answer: Enter the book title , author or keyword in the search bar and browse the results to find the book you are looking for.

what to do if book not issuing from kios.answer: If the book is not issuing from the kiosk , please come to the library helpdesk for assistance.

how to find book on shelf|book shelf loc.answer: Books in the library are organized using the DDC system . Each book has unique accession number and shelves are arranged by call no. you can easily locate books by referring their classification and accession number through koha web opac.

what to do if can't find book on shelf|b.answer: Kindly visit the library helpdesk for assistance.

where are fiction books|fiction books lo.answer: You can find fiction books on the 1st floor , in the corner of the nook area .

how are books organized in library|libra.answer: Stack & Reading Area 1(Ground Floor)-Computer Science; Basic Sciences; Humanities (Class No. -000-599). Stack & Reading Area 2(Ground Floor)-Engineering and Technology; The Art(Class No.600-799). Fiction books - 1st floor. Reference books – 1st floor.

where can I find faculty publication|fac.answer: Faculty publication are located on the first floor , in the corner of the nook area next to fiction books.

what are reference books|reference books.answer: Reference books are the books that are used for quick consultation and cannot be borrowed.

can PhD student issue reference books|Ph.answer: Yes, only phd students can issue reference book for 1 week. Note:- Reference material cannot be issued out of the Library.

how to distinguish reference and book ba.answer: Reference books are marked in green label and are kept on the first floor in the reference section and book bank books are marked in blue strip and are kept in the reading area 2 on the last rack.

how will I get library membership|librar.answer: Please visit library helpdesk for assistance.

can outsider get library membership|exte.answer: Yes, before taking the membership please drop an email regarding your deatils and reasons for availing the library membership to <libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in> and for the availibility of space in the library. The forms are available on library website <https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/external_library_membership.php>

is it ID card or library card|smart card.answer: This smart card serves dual purpose; it is going to be your Institute Identity Card as well as a Library Smart Identity Card.

what is smart about institute library ca.answer: The Institute cum Library Smart Identity Card is embedded with a chip that contains patrons' information as well as library account details. Using this smart card, users can carry out self-service such as issue, return, renew of books on the Kiosk.

contact person for smart identity card|s.answer: Mr. Vineet Jamwal can be contacted at vineet.jamwal@iitrpr.ac.in

can I bring own books and laptop|persona.answer: You are allowed to bring your personal books, other reading materials, and laptops inside the library.

do I have to make entry of books and lap.answer: Proper entry of laptops, personal books should be made in the Entry/Exit Portal.

how to change koha login password|koha p.answer: To change password, click on forget password on your opac login.

is there research writing assistance|res.answer: The library provides access to Grammarly and Overleaf Tools, helping researchers improve their writing skills and simplifying the process of writing academic documents and collaboration, especially those with complex formatting requirements.

is library open on public holidays|libra.answer: Library opens all the days of the year including public holidays.

can I access library computers|library c.answer: Yes, you can use library's computers only for the purpose of academic and research.

where to send document for plagiarism ch.answer: You can mail your file on libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in

what to do if lost library card|lost car.answer: A fine of Rs. 300/- is applicable on loss of the card, charges are double on each re-issue of the duplicate card.

how can I get clearance of dues|dues cle.answer: You can ask about your overdue account at library helpdesk or check your account on opac with your institute login credentials.

can I use mobile phone in library|mobile.answer: Use of Mobile phone inside the library is strictly prohibited. To avoid disturbance keep it on silent mode and go out to talk when you receive calls.

are there group study areas|group study.answer: Yes can do group study in common sphere but please maintain a low voice to avoid disturbing others.

can I leave belongings in library|belong.answer: Library will not be responsible for the loss or damage of personal belongings of the user.

where are DVDs CDs in library|DVD CD loc.answer: DVDs and CDs are available in the digital learning hub , located between technobooth and cubical area on a rack for easy access.

I have lost my belongings where to find.answer: Please avoid leaving personal belongings unattended. If you have lost something, please inquire at the helpdesk to check if lost item have been submitted there.

lost belongings.answer: If you find lost items in the library, submit them to the helpdesk. If you've lost belongings, check with library staff who maintain a lost and found collection. The library is not responsible for personal belongings; users should always keep valuables with them.

can I book common sphere area|common sph.answer: In common sphere, students can have library related programmes with prior permission.

how can I be aware of library events|lib.answer: You are requested to visit library website for latest news and updates.

whom to suggest about library events|lib.answer: You can submit your suggestions on librarian@iitrpr.ac.in or tarvinder.singh@iitrpr.ac.in

where to give suggestion for library ser.answer: You can give suggestion or review for library services in the suggestion register or drop them in the suggestion box located at the entry/exit gate.

what are timings of printing copies|prin.answer: 9:00 AM to 10:00 PM on all days.

how much do printing cost|printing charg.answer: Rs. 1/- per page (one side) for  and Print Charges. Rs. 10/- per page (one side) for Color Print Charges.

color print outs.answer: Color printing is available at Rs. 10/- per page (one side). Black & white printing costs Rs. 1/- per page. Services are available 9 AM to 10 PM daily.

is there copyright restriction for ing|c.answer: No copyrighted work may be copied, published, disseminated, displayed, performed, without permission of the copyright holder except in accordance with fair use or licensed agreement. This includes DVDs/CDs and other copyrighted material. IIT Ropar may terminate the online access of users who are found to have infringed copyright.

what are techno booths|techno booth defi.answer: Techno booths are the perfect space for practicing group presentation, carrying out group assignment, group lecture discussion digital projects, multimedia content creation, virtual meetings, and other tech-related activities.

how to book techno booths|techno booth b.answer: To book techno booth visit Library Helpdesk.

how to use subject guide|subject guide u.answer: For complete details on the use subject guide, please click here: https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/SubjectsPlus/subjects/index.php

library entry exit portal password forge.answer: 🚪 if you forget your library entry exit portal password, please visit library helpdesk for assistance.

It has 25,000+ books, thousands of e-journals, reference works, databases (Scopus, Web of Science, MathSciNet, etc.), research monographs, and digital tools like Turnitin, Grammarly, and Overleaf. It uses Koha ILMS, RFID technology, OPAC search, and provides extensive research support services.

can you tell me how to issue book|i want.answer: Issue books with your institute ID at the library counter or self-service kiosks. Ensure no outstanding fines. Loan periods depend on user category — check OPAC or staff for specifics.

can you tell me technobooth|i want to kn.answer: Technobooth (Digital Learning Hub) in Nalanda Library provides rooms equipped with interactive touch screens (two 65-inch and one 55-inch) for group study, presentations, and digital projects. Each room accommodates 4–6 persons and can be used for up to 2 hours per day. Facilities include multimedia creation, virtual meetings, and group assignments. Reservation requires an in-person visit to the library helpdesk. Food, drinks, and software installations are not permitted; handle equipment with care.

can you tell me reading room facilities|.answer:
Reading Room Facilities:

can you tell me library timing on weeken.answer: The library is open all year including weekends. Ground Floor (Stack & Reading Area 2) is open 24/7. First Floor is open from 6 AM to 2 AM. Issue/Return via Kiosk is available 24/7; staff counter timings are 9 AM to 12:00 AM even on weekends.

can you tell me library timing on holida.answer: The library is open all year including holidays. Ground Floor (Stack & Reading Area 2) is open 24/7. First Floor is open from 6 AM to 2 AM. Issue/Return via Kiosk is available 24/7; staff counter may have limited hours on holidays.

can you tell me can i visit library at n.answer: Yes! The library Ground Floor (Stack & Reading Area 2) is open 24/7. First Floor is open from 6 AM to 2 AM. You can access the library, issue/return books via Kiosk, and use reading spaces anytime.

can you tell me library midnight access|.answer: Yes, library Ground Floor is open 24/7 including midnight. First Floor is open till 2 AM, Timing may vary during exams & holidays.

can you tell me maximum books i can take.answer: Maximum borrowing limit: Faculty - 12 books, PhD - 6 books, PG - 5 books, UG - 3 books + 1 Book Bank book. Duration varies by category.

can you tell me how many books can i iss.answer: You can issue: Faculty - 12 books, Staff - 4 books, PhD - 6 books, PG - 5 books, UG - 3 books + 1 Book Bank book at a time.

can you tell me how long can i keep libr.answer: Book retention period: Faculty - 1 semester (90 days), Staff - 1 semester, PhD - 4 weeks, PG - 2 weeks, UG - 2 weeks. Book Bank books: 1 semester (6 months).

can you tell me book return date|i want.answer: Book return dates vary: UG/PG - 2 weeks, PhD - 4 weeks, Faculty/Staff - 1 semester. You can check due dates in OPAC or renew via self-service kiosks if not reserved by others.

can you tell me when should i return boo.answer: Return books before the due date to avoid fines. Check your account in OPAC for due dates. Late returns incur fines starting from ₹2 per day subsequently doubling each week.

can you tell me how to reserve a book|i.answer: To reserve a book: 1) Search in OPAC (https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in) 2) If book is issued to someone, click 'Reserve' 3) You'll be notified when book is available 4) Collect within 2 days after notification.

can you tell me book bank service|i want.answer: Book Bank facility is available for UG students. They can borrow one book from the Book Bank category and retain it for an entire semester (6 months).

how many person are allowed in technoboo.answer: Each Technobooth can accommodate 4-6 persons. The library has 3 Technobooth rooms available, and each is equipped with interactive touch screen monitors for group presentations and digital projects.

can you tell me research support iit rop.answer:
Nalanda Library at IIT Ropar provides a wide range of facilities and services:

 Resources: 25,000+ books, e-journals, e-books, research monographs, reference works, fiction, competitive books.
💻 Digital Tools: Scopus, Web of Science, MathSciNet, SciFinder, Prowess IQ, Grammarly, Overleaf, Turnitin.
🔍 OPAC: Online Public Access Catalogue for searching, reserving, and tracking books.
🏛️ Book Bank: UG students can borrow one book per semester (6 months).
🖨️ Printing service: Available 9 AM-10 PM, charges ₹1 per side for b&w and 10 rupay color print per side.
🧑‍🎓 Research Support: Plagiarism checks, citation analysis, workshops, reference services, subject/research guides.
📡 Institutional Digital Repository (IDR): Online theses, dissertations, research publications.
🖥️ Technobooth (Digital Learning Hub): Rooms with interactive touch screens for group work, presentations, and digital projects.
🪑 Reading Spaces: 240+ seating capacity, 24/7 access on the Ground Floor.
 Reference Section & Leisure Reading: Includes competitive exam guides, Hindi & English fiction, and faculty-authored books.
🎓 Orientation Programs: For new students to learn library rules, resources, and tools.
📑 EDD & ILL Services: Electronic Document Delivery and Inter-Library Loan for materials not in the library.

👉 Overall, Nalanda Library provides academic, research, and digital support to help students and faculty succeed.

when does library staff available|what t.answer: Library staff is available from 9:00 AM to 12:00 AM(midnight), Timing may vary during exams & vacations.

how do i extend my book|extend book loan.answer: You can renew your books with institute cum library card via self-service kiosks, if book is reserved by another user, renewal won't be possible.

what if i return book late|late return c.answer: Late book returns incur fines: ₹2.00 per day for the first week after due date. The fine doubles every subsequent week (₹4.00, ₹8.00, ₹16.00, etc.). Return books promptly to avoid penalties.

how many times can i renew book|book ren.answer: You can renew books multiple times through OPAC before the due date, as long as no other user has reserved the book. Each renewal extends the loan period based on your user category. Check OPAC 'My Account' for renewal status and eligibility.

can i reserve book online|how to reserve.answer: Yes! You can reserve books online through OPAC (https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in). Search for the book, click on it, and select 'Reserve' if it's currently issued to someone else. You'll be notified via email when the book becomes available for you to collect.

how do i pay library fine|fine payment m.answer: Library fines can be paid at the circulation desk during staff hours (9:00 AM - 5:30 PM on working days). You can check your outstanding fines in OPAC under 'My Account'. Contact libraryhelp@iitrpr.ac.in for payment queries or alternative payment arrangements.

can i suggest book purchase|request new.answer: Yes! You can suggest books for library purchase. Fill out the book recommendation form available on the library website or email your suggestions to library@iitrpr.ac.in with book title, author, ISBN, and justification. The library committee reviews all suggestions regularly.

how long to get requested book|book requ.answer: Book purchase requests are reviewed by the library committee periodically. Processing time varies from 4-8 weeks depending on vendor availability, budget approval, and procurement procedures. You'll be notified once the requested book is available in the library catalog.

what is book bank scheme|how book bank w.answer: Book Bank is a scheme where UG students can borrow one prescribed textbook for an entire semester (6 months) free of charge. This is in addition to their regular 3-book borrowing limit. Book Bank books are marked separately and must be returned at semester end in good condition.

which books are in book bank|book bank c.answer: Book Bank contains course textbooks prescribed by faculty for undergraduate programs. The collection includes core textbooks for all UG courses. Search OPAC (https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in) and filter by 'Book Bank' to see available titles. Lists are updated each semester.

can pg students use book bank|is book ba.answer: Book Bank is primarily for UG (undergraduate) students including BTech programs.

how to search book by subject|find books.answer: Use OPAC (https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in) to search by subject. Enter keywords related to your topic in the search box and select 'Subject' from the dropdown.

where are engineering books|location of.answer:
Books are arranged by Dewey Decimal Classification (DDC) system:
• Computer Science: 000s section
• Mathematics: 500s section
• Engineering: 600s section
• Applied Sciences: 600s section

Use OPAC to find the exact call number and floor location. Floor maps are displayed near the entrance for guidance.

dewey decimal classification|dewey class.answer: Books are arranged by the Dewey Decimal Classification (DDC) system. The DDC number shows the subject category and shelf location. Use OPAC to find the exact call number and then locate the book in the corresponding DDC section on the shelves.

what is call number|how to read call num.answer: Call Number is a unique code that indicates a book's location in the library. It's based on the Dewey Decimal Classification (DDC) system. The number shows the subject category and shelf position. When you search OPAC, note the call number to locate the book on shelves.

can i take reference book home|reference.answer: No, reference books (encyclopedias, handbooks, dictionaries) are non-circulating and cannot be borrowed. They must be used within the library only.

thesis borrowing allowed|can i borrow ph.answer: PhD theses and dissertations are non-circulating and cannot be borrowed. They are available for reference within the library only. You can access digital versions through the Institutional Digital Repository (IDR) at https://www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/

library workshop schedule|when are libra.answer: The library conducts regular workshops on database searching, citation management, plagiarism detection, and research tools. Workshop schedules are announced via email and posted on the library website.

interlibrary loan how long|ill processin.answer: Interlibrary Loan (ILL) and Electronic Document Delivery (EDD) requests are typically processed within 3-7 working days, depending on the source library's response time. You'll receive an email notification when your requested document is ready for collection or delivered electronically.

can i request article from other library.answer: Yes! Use the Electronic Document Delivery (EDD) and Inter-Library Loan (ILL) services. Submit your request through the library website or email subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in with complete citation details. The library will obtain articles, book chapters, or entire books from partner libraries across India.

group study room booking|discussion room.answer: Super easy! 😊 Just walk up to the library helpdesk and ask to book a Technobooth room. We don't do advance bookings - it's first come, first served! Each room fits 4-6 people and you get it for 2 hours. Check with our staff for current availability!

silent zone in library|quiet study area|.answer: The entire library maintains a quiet environment for focused study. Ground Floor Stack & Reading Area 2 is open 24/7 and provides silent study spaces. Maintain silence, keep mobile phones on silent mode, and respect fellow users. For discussions, use Technobooth rooms.

laptop charging facility|power outlets i.answer: Yes, power outlets are available at reading desks throughout the library for charging laptops and devices. Please use your own chargers and cables. Avoid leaving devices unattended. The library is not responsible for personal belongings.

locker facility in library|can i store b.answer: Bags should be kept at designated racks near the entry gate. The library is not responsible for lost or stolen personal items.

library membership card lost|what if i l.answer: If you lose your Institute-cum-Library Smart ID card, report it immediately to the circulation desk. Replacement fee is ₹300 for the first duplicate, doubling for subsequent replacements. Submit an application at Library Helpdesk; the new card will be ready in 2-3 working days.

temporary library access without card|fo.answer: If you forget your Smart ID card, you may be allowed temporary entry with your Institute ID or valid identification after verification at the Library Helpdesk. However, you cannot issue or return books without your Smart ID card. Always carry your card for full library access.

newspaper reading area|where to read new.answer: Newspapers and current periodicals are available in the reading area. The library subscribes to major national dailies and magazines. You can also access 7,000+ e-newspapers and magazines from 130+ countries through PressReader via the library's e-resources portal.

magazine subscription list|which magazin.answer: The library subscribes to academic journals, magazines, and periodicals across various disciplines. Lists of subscribed print and digital periodicals are available on the library website under 'E-Resources' and 'Print Collections'.

how to download research papers|paper do.answer: Access research papers through the library's e-resources portal. On campus, direct access is available. Off-campus, connect via IIT Ropar VPN first. Navigate to databases like IEEE, ACM, ScienceDirect, SpringerLink, etc., search for papers, and download PDFs. Contact subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in if you encounter access issues.

research paper not downloading|access de.answer: If you cannot download a paper: 1) Verify you're on campus network or connected to VPN, 2) Check if the library subscribes to that journal, 3) Try accessing through a different database. If problems persist, request the paper via EDD/ILL service by emailing Subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in with full citation.

how to check library account|view my bor.answer: Login to OPAC (https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in) using your institute credentials. Under 'My Account', you can view all borrowed books, due dates, fines, reservation status, borrowing history, and renew books online. Update your contact information and preferences in the profile section.

forgot opac password|cannot login opac|r.answer: OPAC login uses your institute credentials (Entry number). If you've forgotten your password, contact the Library helpdesk to reset your credentials.

summer vacation library timing|library h.answer: Ground Floor (Stack & Reading Area 2) remains open 24/7 throughout the year including summer vacations and holidays. First Floor operates from 6 AM to 2 AM. Staff counter hours may be reduced during vacations. Check library notices for specific holiday timings.

exam period library timing|extended hour.answer: During examination periods, the library provides extended access and support. Ground Floor is always 24/7. Staff counter hours may be extended.

books count|total books|how many books|b.answer: 📚 The library has 25,000+ books (print collection), e-books, reference materials, theses, and print journals. Digital access includes e-journals from major publishers and 7,000+ newspapers from 130+ countries via PressReader.

staff hours|librarian hours|circulation.answer: Library staff is available at the Library Helpdesk from 9:00 AM to 12:00 AM(midnight),Timing May vary during exams and holidays. For assistance during these hours, visit the desk or call/email. Self-service kiosks are available 24/7 for book issue/return using your Smart ID card.

fine rate|overdue charges|late fee amoun.answer: Fine is ₹2.00 per day for the first week after due date. It doubles every subsequent week (₹4.00, ₹8.00, ₹16.00, etc.).

library map|floor plan|library layout|wh.answer: Library floor maps are displayed near the entrance showing book locations by Dewey Classification. Ground Floor has Stack & Reading Area 2 (24/7 access). First Floor has main collection, reference section, reading spaces, and circulation desk. Technobooth rooms are available for group study. Ask staff for specific section locations.

mobile app|library app|smartphone access.answer: Access library services online through OPAC (https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in) which is mobile-friendly. Login to search books, renew loans, reserve items, and check your account from any device. No separate mobile app required.

book donation|donate books|can i give bo.answer: The library accepts book donations that align with academic and research needs. Contact library@iitrpr.ac.in with details (title, author, ISBN, condition) before bringing books.

visitor library access|can outsiders ent.answer: External membership is available for Academic Institutions, Research Organizations, Government Departments, Industry professionals, academicians, and researchers. Membership requires institute approval and a refundable security deposit. Visitors may access the library with prior permission. Contact libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in for details.

book donation to library|can i donate bo.answer: The library welcomes book donations relevant to academic programs and research. Contact library@iitrpr.ac.in before donating.

damaged book found|book pages torn|repor.answer: If you find a damaged book, report it immediately to the Library desk before issuing it to avoid being held responsible. If you damage a book in your possession, inform library staff. You may need to replace it with a new copy or reimburse the current price plus processing fees.

photography in library|can i take photos.answer: Photography or video recording inside the library requires prior permission from library administration. For personal study notes, you may photograph book pages (within copyright limits). Professional photography or recording for events/projects needs formal approval. Contact libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in for permission.

library feedback system|how to give sugg.answer: The library welcomes feedback and suggestions. You can submit feedback through the library website, email libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in. Your input helps improve library services and resources. All feedback is reviewed by the library committee regularly.

new arrivals in library|recently added b.answer: New arrivals and recently added books are displayed on the library website and near the circulation desk. You can also search OPAC with date filters to find latest additions. The library regularly updates collections based on curriculum needs and user recommendations.

book exhibition in library|library event.answer: The library organizes book exhibitions, author talks, workshops, and information literacy programs throughout the year. Event announcements are made via email, website, and library notice boards.

open access journals|free research paper.answer: The library provides links to open access journals and repositories. Resources like DOAJ (Directory of Open Access Journals), arXiv, PubMed Central, and institutional repositories offer free research papers. Check the library website's open access section or ask staff for guidance on finding free scholarly content.

copyright for thesis|can i publish my th.answer: Your thesis is your intellectual property, but submitted theses may be made available through the library's Institutional Digital Repository (IDR) as per institute policy. Consult the library for guidance on copyright, embargo periods, and publishing rights.

h-index calculation|citation metrics|res.answer: The library provides access to tools for calculating h-index and other citation metrics through databases like Scopus, Web of Science, and Google Scholar.

journal impact factor|how to check journ.answer: Check journal impact factors using Web of Science (Journal Citation Reports), Scopus (CiteScore), or other bibliometric tools available through the library. Library staff can guide you on evaluating journal quality, identifying reputable publishers, and avoiding predatory journals for publication.

library newsletter|library updates|how t.answer: The library sends regular email updates about new resources, services, events, and workshops to all registered users. You can also check the library website and notice boards for announcements. Subscribe to library social media channels for timely updates on library activities.

career resources library|placement prepa.answer: The library maintains a collection of books for competitive exams (GATE, UPSC, etc.), interview preparation, aptitude tests, and career development. These are available in the reference section. Some may be available for short-term borrowing. Check OPAC for specific titles.

project report format|thesis formatting.answer: Thesis and project report formatting guidelines are usually provided by your academic department.

study material for courses|course textbo.answer: Course textbooks prescribed by faculty are available in the library collection, including Book Bank copies for UG students. Search OPAC by course code, subject, or book title. If a required textbook is not available, you can request it for purchase through the book recommendation system.

how many books can faculty borrow|facult.answer: Faculty members can borrow up to 12 books for one semester. They also have access to EDD/ILL services, off-campus e-resource access via VPN, Turnitin, Grammarly, and Overleaf institutional accounts.

staff borrowing privileges|non-teaching.answer: Non-teaching staff members can borrow up to 4 books for one semester. All institute staff have full access to library facilities, e-resources, and services using their Institute Smart ID card. Contact the Library Helpdesk for specific queries about staff privileges.

how to submit thesis to repository|thesi.answer: PhD scholars must have to submit hard and soft copies of their theses to the library as per institute requirements. The library adds them to the Institutional Digital Repository. Contact Subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in for submission procedures, required formats, and metadata requirements.

remote access troubleshooting|vpn not wo.answer: If you're having trouble accessing library e-resources off-campus: 1) Ensure VPN is connected properly, 2) Verify your institute credentials are correct, 3) Clear browser cache/cookies, 4) Try a different browser. If problems persist, contact IT helpdesk for VPN issues or libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in for resource access issues.

library committee members|who manages li.answer: Nalanda Library is managed by professional staff under the guidance of the Library Committee comprising senior faculty members from various departments. The committee oversees policy decisions, resource acquisition, and service improvements. Committee details are available on the library website.

library budget|book purchase allocation|.answer: The library operates on an annual budget allocated by the institute for resources, subscriptions, and services. Book and journal purchases are made through approved vendors after committee approval. User recommendations are considered during budget planning.

sustainable practices library|green libr.answer: The library promotes sustainability through digital resources (reducing paper usage), energy-efficient lighting, encouraging e-books and e-journals, and responsible printing/ing. Users are encouraged to use digital resources when possible and follow eco-friendly practices within library spaces.

accessibility services library|facilitie.answer: The library strives to provide accessible services for all users including those with disabilities. Facilities may include accessible seating, elevator access, and assistive technologies. Contact libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in in advance to discuss specific accessibility needs or accommodations required.

lost and found library|found item in lib.answer: If you find lost items in the library, submit them to the Library Helpdesk. If you've lost belongings, check with library staff who maintain a lost and found collection. The library is not responsible for personal belongings; users should always keep valuables with them.

library seating capacity|how many seats.answer: Nalanda Library has a seating capacity of 240+ in reading areas. Ground Floor Stack & Reading Area 2 (24/7 access) and First Floor (6 AM - 2 AM) provide ample study spaces. Seat availability varies by time and season. During peak hours or exams, arrive early to secure preferred seating.

cctv in library|security cameras|surveil.answer: The library premises are monitored by CCTV cameras for security and safety of users and resources. Video surveillance helps prevent theft, monitor unauthorized access, and ensure a safe environment. All recordings are handled as per institute security and privacy policies.

library annual statistics|usage reports|.answer: The library publishes annual reports with statistics on collection size, circulation, e-resource usage, user visits, and services provided. These reports highlight library achievements and growth. Access annual reports and statistics on the library website under 'About Us'.

digital literacy programs|computer skill.answer: The library conducts information literacy and digital skills workshops including database searching, citation tools, plagiarism detection, LaTeX writing with Overleaf, and research data management. Workshop schedules are announced regularly. Register through library emails or contact libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in for upcoming sessions.

library social media|follow library upda.answer: Yes Nalanda Library is active on Social media, like Facebook, instagram and Linkdlin, Stay connected with library updates, new resources, events, and tips by following the library's official communication channels.

book club in library|reading circle|lite.answer: Check with library staff or the library website for information about book clubs, reading circles, or literary events. The library's leisure reading section includes Hindi and English fiction. Such community programs depend on student interest and volunteers. Contact libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in to propose or join reading initiatives.

multimedia resources library|audio books.answer: The library maintains a collection of CDs, DVDs, and other multimedia resources for academic use. These include educational videos, lecture series, and documentation. Multimedia items may have different borrowing rules. Check with circulation desk or search OPAC for available multimedia materials.

textbook reserve system|high demand book.answer: High-demand textbooks and course reserves may have shorter loan periods to ensure wider access. Book Bank books for UG students are reserved for semester-long loans. If a book you need is always checked out, ask staff about reserve copies or request additional copies through the book recommendation system.

library mobile app|opac mobile version|l.answer: OPAC (https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in) is accessible via mobile browsers. Mobile access allows you to search catalog, check account, renew books, and access e-resources on your smartphone or tablet.

emergency closure library|unexpected hol.answer: In case of emergency closures or unexpected holidays, announcements are made via email, library website, and institute channels. Self-service kiosks for book return remain available when possible. Due dates may be extended during closures. Check official communications for updates during emergency situations.

library renovation updates|construction.answer: During renovation or construction, the library makes efforts to minimize disruption to services. Alternative arrangements for resources and seating are provided. Updates on renovation schedules, affected services, and temporary arrangements are communicated via email and website announcements.

thank library staff|appreciate library s.answer: We appreciate your positive feedback! You can commend library staff or express appreciation through the feedback system on the library website, email to libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in, or by speaking with library administration. Your recognition motivates staff to continue providing excellent service.

can you tell me grammarly access|i want.answer: Grammarly access is available for students and researchers through institutional licenses. Contact the subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in for activation details.

when does library open|when does library.answer: The library is open all year. Ground Floor (Stack & Reading Area 2) is open 24/7. First Floor is open from 6 AM to 2 AM. Issue/Return via Kiosk is available 24/7; staff counter timings are 9 AM to 12:00 AM. During exams & vacations timing may vary.

library open on sunday.answer: Yes! The library is open all days including Sunday. Ground Floor (Stack & Reading Area 2) is open 24/7. First Floor is open from 6 AM to 2 AM. Self-service kiosks are available 24/7. During exams & vacations timing may vary.

library open on saturday.answer: Yes! The library is open all days including Saturday. Ground Floor (Stack & Reading Area 2) is open 24/7. First Floor is open from 6 AM to 2 AM. Self-service kiosks are available 24/7. During exams & vacations timing may vary.

how late is library open.answer: Ground Floor (Stack & Reading Area 2) is open 24/7. First Floor closes at 2 AM. Self-service kiosks are available round the clock. During exams & vacations timing may vary.

library night hours.answer: Ground Floor (Stack & Reading Area 2) is open 24/7 including all night. First Floor is open till 2 AM. During exams & vacations timing may vary. You can study, access resources, and use self-service kiosks anytime.

can i study at night.answer: Yes! The library Ground Floor (Stack & Reading Area 2) is open 24/7. First Floor is open from 6 AM to 2 AM. You can access the library, issue/return books via Kiosk, and use reading spaces anytime.

how do i renew book.answer: Login to OPAC (https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in) with your credentials, go to 'My Account', select the book you want to renew, and click the 'Renew' button. You can also renew at the library counter.

renew book online.answer: Login to OPAC (https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in) with your credentials, go to 'My Account', select the book you want to renew, and click the 'Renew' button.

how many times can i renew.answer: You can renew books multiple times through OPAC as long as no one else has reserved the book. Check your OPAC account for renewal options.

can i renew after due date.answer: It's best to renew before the due date to avoid fines. If a book is overdue, you may need to return it or contact the library staff. Fines will apply for overdue books.

where can i pay fine.answer: You can pay library fines at the library circulation counter during staff hours (9 AM - 12:00 AM(midnight) on any days). Check your OPAC account for outstanding fine details.

how to pay library fine.answer: Visit the library circulation counter during staff hours (9 AM - 12:00 AM(midnight) on any days) to pay your fine. You can check your fine amount in OPAC under 'My Account'.

check my fine.answer: Login to OPAC (https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in) and go to 'My Account' to view all your borrowed books, due dates, and any outstanding fines.

how much is my fine.answer: Login to OPAC (https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in) and check 'My Account' to see your current fine amount. Fine is ₹2 per day per book for the first week, doubling each subsequent week.

what if i lose a book.answer: Lost books must be replaced with the latest edition or you must reimburse the current price plus a processing fee. Contact the library helpdesk immediately if you lose a book.

book damaged what to do.answer: Inform the library staff immediately if a book is damaged. Depending on the damage, you may need to pay for repairs or replacement. Do not attempt to repair it yourself.

book reservation.answer: Search for the book in OPAC (https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in). If it's checked out, you can place a hold/reservation. You'll be notified via email when it's available for pickup.

can i reserve book.answer: Yes! Login to OPAC (https://opac.iitrpr.ac.in), search for the book, and click 'Reserve' or 'Hold' if the book is currently issued. You'll be notified when available.

wifi password library.answer: The library has WiFi available. Use your institute credentials to connect to the IIT Ropar network. For WiFi issues, contact the IT support desk.

internet in library.answer: Yes, WiFi is available throughout the library. Connect using your institute credentials. The library also has computers for academic use.

laptop charging in library.answer: Power outlets are available in reading areas for charging laptops and devices. Please use them responsibly and don't block access for others.

can i use my laptop.answer: Yes, you can bring and use your personal laptop in the library. Power outlets are available in reading areas. WiFi is accessible with institute credentials.

study room booking.answer: For group study, you can book Technobooth rooms by visiting the library helpdesk in person. Common sphere area is also available for group discussions (maintain low voice).

how to book study room.answer: Technobooth rooms are available for group study and presentations. Reservation requires an in-person visit to the library helpdesk (no advance bookings). Each room seats 4-6 persons and is available for up to 2 hours per day. Check with staff for current availability.

group study space.answer: Group study is allowed in the common sphere area (maintain low voice). For collaborative work, you can book Technobooth rooms at the helpdesk (4-6 persons capacity).

silent zone library.answer: Yes, the library has designated silent reading zones. Please maintain complete silence in these areas. Keep mobile phones on silent and go outside for calls.

food allowed in library.answer: No food or drinks are allowed inside the library reading areas and book stacks to maintain cleanliness and protect books. Drinking water is permitted in covered bottles. For meals, please use designated dining areas outside the library. Violating this rule may result in warnings or penalties.

water bottle in library.answer: Small water bottles in closed containers may be allowed, but it's best to check with staff. Keep them in your bag and avoid spilling near books and computers.

librarian contact.answer: Contact the librarian at librarian@iitrpr.ac.in or visit the library website for complete staff contact details.

scan documents in library.answer: No, Printing services are not available in the library. Visit the helpdesk for assistance.

charges.answer: Printing charges: ₹1 per page (one side) for black & white. Color copies: ₹10 per side. Available from 9 AM to 10 PM.

how to print in library.answer: Visit the helpdesk in the library (available 9 AM - 10 PM). Charges: ₹1 per side for B&W, ₹10 per side for color printing.

how to check plagiarism.answer: Send your document to library@iitrpr.ac.in for Turnitin plagiarism check. Include your name, roll number, and department. You'll receive the similarity report via email.

grammarly for students.answer: IIT Ropar provides institutional Grammarly access for academic writing. Contact subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in for activation using your institute email.

how to get grammarly.answer: Sign up for Grammarly using your institute email (@iitrpr.ac.in). For institutional premium access, contact subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in.

latex editor.answer: The library provides access to Overleaf, a collaborative LaTeX editor. Visit https://www.overleaf.com/edu/iitrpr for institutional access or contact subscriptions@iitrpr.ac.in for assistance.

book not available.answer: If a book is not available in the library, you can: 1) Request it through Inter-Library Loan (ILL) service, 2) Suggest it for purchase by emailing library@iitrpr.ac.in.

request new book.answer: Yes! You can suggest books for library purchase. Fill out the book recommendation form available on the library website or email your suggestions to library@iitrpr.ac.in with book title, author, ISBN, and justification. The library committee reviews all suggestions regularly.

suggest book purchase.answer: Email library@iitrpr.ac.in with your book purchase suggestion including title, author, ISBN, and reason. The library evaluates all requests.

reference books location.answer: Reference books are located on the first floor in the reference section. They are marked with green labels and cannot be borrowed (library use only).

where are reference books.answer: Reference books are on the first floor in the designated reference section. They have green labels and are for in-library use only (cannot be issued).

can i borrow reference book.answer: Reference books cannot be borrowed by most users. Only PhD students can issue reference books for 1 week, but they cannot take them out of the library premises.

book bank books.answer: Book Bank Service is for UG students. You can borrow one book from the book bank category for the entire semester (6 months). Book bank books are marked with blue strips.

where are book bank books.answer: Book bank books are marked with blue strips and are kept in Reading Area 2 on the last rack (ground floor).

competitive exam books.answer: The library maintains a collection of books for competitive exams (GATE, UPSC, CAT, GRE, etc.), interview preparation, aptitude tests, and career development. These are available in the reference section. Some may be available for short-term borrowing. Check OPAC for specific titles.

gate books library.answer: GATE preparation books are available in the reference section and competitive exam books area. Search OPAC for specific titles or ask library staff.

novels in library.answer: Novels and fiction books are available on the 1st floor in the nook area corner. Check OPAC or browse the fiction section for available titles.

ieee access.answer: IEEE Xplore database is available to all IIT Ropar users. On-campus: direct access. Off-campus: connect via VPN first, then access through library website.

scopus database.answer: Scopus is available for IIT Ropar users. Access it through the library's e-resources page. Off-campus users need VPN connection.

web of science.answer: Web of Science database is accessible to IIT Ropar community. Visit library e-resources page. Off-campus access requires VPN.

springer ebooks.answer: SpringerLink e-books are available through library subscriptions. Access via library e-resources page. Use VPN for off-campus access.

sciencedirect access.answer: ScienceDirect (Elsevier) is available through library subscriptions. On-campus: direct access. Off-campus: use VPN, then visit library e-resources page.

jstor access.answer: JSTOR database is accessible to IIT Ropar users through library e-resources. Off-campus access requires VPN connection.

how to download papers.answer: On-campus: directly access databases via library e-resources page and download papers. Off-campus: connect to VPN first, then access databases.

research paper download.answer: Access research papers through library e-resources (IEEE, Springer, ScienceDirect, etc.). On-campus: direct access. Off-campus: use VPN. For unavailable papers, use ILL/EDD service.

vpn setup.answer: VPN is provided by IIT Ropar IT services. Use institute credentials to connect. For VPN setup help, contact IT support or libraryhelpdesk@iitrpr.ac.in.

off campus access.answer: To access library e-resources from off-campus: 1) Connect to IIT Ropar VPN using institute credentials, 2) Then access library website and e-resources as usual.

remote access library.answer: For remote access to library e-resources, connect to IIT Ropar VPN first using your institute credentials, then access databases and journals through the library website.

library from home.answer: Access library e-resources from home by: 1) Connecting to IIT Ropar VPN, 2) Visiting library website (www.iitrpr.ac.in/library/), 3) Accessing e-resources/databases.
